law.text:
As used in KRS 224.1-450 to 224.1-465, unless the context otherwise requires:
"Property" means a parcel or parcels of real property owned by a public entity upon which a release of a hazardous substance, pollutant, or contaminant has occurred.
"Public entity" means the Commonwealth of Kentucky, a county, city, urban-county government, charter county government, or any of their agencies, departments, or any KRS 58.180 nonprofit nonstock corporation.
"Remediation plan" means a plan approved by the cabinet whereby the public entity will remediate hazardous substances, pollutants, or contaminants released upon the property.
law.history: Created 1996 Ky. Acts ch. 194, sec. 69, effective July 15, 1996.
